ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient presents with an atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor, which is strongly associated with Rhabdoid tumor predisposition syndrome 1, as evidenced by the similar reference cases.
While less common than syndrome 1, this subtype also predisposes to atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors and should be considered.
This condition involves mutations in SMARCA4, which can lead to rhabdoid tumors, though it is less directly associated with the specific tumor type in this case.
This syndrome involves SMARCA4 mutations and has been loosely associated with rhabdoid tumors, though it is a less likely cause compared to the predisposition syndromes.
